benchmark_details.name: SolBench
benchmark_details.overview: SolBench is a benchmark for evaluating the functional correctness of Solidity smart contracts generated by code completion models, consisting of 4,178 functions from 1,155 Ethereum-deployed contracts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the Solidity coding capabilities of large language models (LLMs) by evaluating their functional correctness in smart contract code completion.

data.source: Collected from Ethereum smart contracts using Etherscan and filtered for unique and active contracts.
data.annotation: Automated functional correctness verification via differential fuzzing.

methodology.calculation: Functional correctness is verified by checking if completed functions produce correct outputs with the same inputs.
methodology.interpretation: A higher pass rate indicates better performance in functional correctness for Solidity code completion by models.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using various closed-source and open-source LLMs.
